intro: Matelea endressiae, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators like moths. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a velvety texture. Matelea endressiae is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
